titleStmt.title: G. W. Baker et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG4850

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
To His Excelencey Thos E Bramlette
Governor of Kentuckey

the undersigned petitioners Residents of Boone County Respectfulley Represent to your Excelency that Vincent Ross & John Frillilom Were Each fined at the fall term of the Gallatin Circuit ^1863^ Twenty Dollars & Cost and that Wm Black and F Moore was at the fall ^Spring^ term of said Court 1864 fined the Same Amount for playing Cards your petitioners State that Each & all of the above named Defendants are Quiet peaceble Good Citizens and are poor laboring men & have Families dependent on their dayler labor for a support your petitioners also State that to the best of their knowledge the defendants are not in the habbit of Gaming and as they promise will not indulge any more now therefore your petitioners humbley Request that your Exclincey Remit said fines and allow the whole labors of the Defts to be devoted to the Maintanence of their Families who Stand verry much in need of their labor
And your petitioners will ever pray

G W Baker dep County Court Clk
A Q Baker Sheriff, D. C
Wm H Baker Representative, D. C
Jas F Robberts
Osar Baker
Steward Baker
John Kelley
J M Hume
A E Hume
S O Finnell
Jas Murphey
G W Minamarna
W W Garrett
David Richison Jr
Ben B Allphin
Samuel Rix
E H Baker
C C Hume
Henry Reib
Charles Rook
Edward Dorman
J T Black
Wm J Black
D C Glore
